intro: Paraixeris sonchifolia var. serotina, commonly known as the late-flowering variant of the genus Paraixeris, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and foliage with serrated edges. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are generally lance-shaped and can be hairy, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in a composite inflorescence. It is noted for its ornamental value and adaptability to various environmental conditions.
